project.title: The Commi$$ion
project.logline: An underrecognized painter accepts a lucrative commission from a mysterious buyer, only to be pulled into an escalating series of bizarre staged events that threaten his sanity, reputation, and career — until he discovers the truth behind the art-world puppet master controlling his fate.
project.story_overview: Jason Towne, a struggling but talented painter, takes a high-paying commission that becomes stranger every day. As documentary cameras follow his process, an eccentric buyer orchestrates dramatic confrontations, a staged robbery, a fake bounty, and a chaotic art-show heist — all to shock Jason out of obscurity. The final twist reveals the buyer as a filmmaker creating a series of ‘scam-based art documentaries,’ with Jason as the first subject.
project_goals: To create a feature length AI pre-visualation of the script including video,SFX,dialog and music.
To position the project for potential production funding or partnerships with indie film studios.
To establish a pilot for a potential web series exploring similar art-world scams and schemes each featuring different artists.
project.target_audience: Art enthusiasts, independent film lovers, and audiences who appreciate dark humor
executives: Michael Souza - Co-Producer/Lead Antagonist/Cinematographer/Editor/Sound Designer/Musical Score
Scott Grocott - Co-Producer/AI Visual Effects Supervisor/AI Prompt Engineer/Character Actor

themes: the absurdity of the art market

main_characters.name: Jason Towne
main_characters.description: Painter in his early 40s, honest, introspective, habitually broke but deeply dedicated to his work. The documentary subject and emotional anchor of the story.

main_characters.name: Stacey
main_characters.description: Smart, observant, calm in chaos. Hired by Franklin to film Jason’s process but grows loyal to Jason.

main_characters.name: Kenny
main_characters.description: Long-time friend and fellow artist. Loyal, funny, impulsive, unexpectedly heroic during the heist.

main_characters.name: Catherine
main_characters.description: Warm, charismatic, seemingly traditional — actually part of Franklin’s scheme.

main_characters.name: Franklin B. Stevenson
main_characters.description: An eccentric millionaire filmmaker who stages elaborate 'scam-like' experiences as high art.

main_characters.name: Martin Jenkins
main_characters.description: Witty, pretentious, charmingly rude. Hosts a podcast Jason appears on.

main_characters.name: Randal
main_characters.description: Pretends to warn Jason about a scam; secretly works for Franklin.

recurring_locations: The Drunken Art Critic podcast studio

scene_index.title: Day One – Underpainting
scene_index.synopsis: Jason begins the commission by exploding spray paint cans; Stacey films the chaotic creation of the first layer.

scene_index.title: Day Two – Trash at the Studio
scene_index.synopsis: Jason arrives to find trash scattered by dumpster-divers; frustration sets the tone for the day.

scene_index.title: Brush Stroke Layer
scene_index.synopsis: Jason begins expressive brushwork, discussing focus, flow, and fulfillment with Stacey.

scene_index.title: Day Three – More Trash
scene_index.synopsis: Jason finds the dumpster trashed again, increasing his agitation.

scene_index.title: Line Work Preparation
scene_index.synopsis: Jason sets up a table, has an awkward encounter with a random visitor, and prepares for detailed line work.

scene_index.title: Illustration Phase Begins
scene_index.synopsis: Jason starts outlining his brush strokes; a long time-lapse captures his meticulous method.

scene_index.title: Morning Journaling & The Bag
scene_index.synopsis: Jason reveals his gross strategy for deterring dumpster-divers; Stacey reacts with horror.

scene_index.title: Dumpster Victory
scene_index.synopsis: The trash is finally gone thanks to Jason’s ‘tactic’; they begin another painting day.

scene_index.title: Painting Montage – Days 6–12
scene_index.synopsis: A montage of progress over many days as the painting approaches completion.

scene_index.title: Final Brush Stroke
scene_index.synopsis: Jason finishes the painting and plans to clear-coat it after a day of drying.

scene_index.title: Clear Coat & Kenny Visits
scene_index.synopsis: Kenny arrives; Jason reveals the strange NDA commission; they discuss the contract’s mysteries.

scene_index.title: Signing the Painting
scene_index.synopsis: Jason signs and dates the back, preparing for his podcast appearance.

scene_index.title: Drunken Art Critic Podcast
scene_index.synopsis: Jason is interviewed by Martin Jenkins; a mix of insults, wine, and backhanded compliments ensues.

scene_index.title: Art Knowing Article
scene_index.synopsis: Martin’s written review is surprisingly positive; Jason reviews the marketing events in his contract.

scene_index.title: Train Tunnel Photo Shoot
scene_index.synopsis: Jason, Stacey, and Kenny shoot photos in a 'bad neighborhood' tunnel—and get mugged.

scene_index.title: Art Show Setup
scene_index.synopsis: Jason installs his show; Stacey picks her favorite piece; Franklin texts with cryptic hints.

scene_index.title: Call With Franklin
scene_index.synopsis: Franklin reveals the $50k theft bounty; Jason reacts with disbelief and alarm.

scene_index.title: Art Show Reception
scene_index.synopsis: Catherine announces the theft challenge; Mary reveals another artist was scammed; Jason panics.

scene_index.title: Outside The Art Show
scene_index.synopsis: Jason vents; he decides to call the previous scammed artist.

scene_index.title: Truck Ride – Processing Everything
scene_index.synopsis: Jason describes his growing fear of being scammed as they return to the studio.

scene_index.title: Back at the Studio – Call With Randal
scene_index.synopsis: Randal convinces Jason the money is fake; Jason panics and plans to steal back the painting.

scene_index.title: Planning the Heist
scene_index.synopsis: Jason and Kenny plan a chaotic grab-and-run strategy.

scene_index.title: Stacey’s Loyalty Questioned
scene_index.synopsis: Jason debates whether Stacey is trustworthy; she reveals she also was paid in prop money.

scene_index.title: The Heist
scene_index.synopsis: Kenny distracts the guard; Jason steals the painting; key fob fails; they run all the way back.

scene_index.title: Revelation at the Studio
scene_index.synopsis: Franklin reveals the entire operation: no scam, all real money, and a documentary series.

scene_index.title: Meeting With Drew Davis
scene_index.synopsis: Jason takes Franklin’s role and recruits the next artist for the next documentary.
